page.title: 09A Small Rutland Village.
page.content: STOKE DRY is a small village with a population of 60.There are 12 houses, mostly built of ironstone,2 of which are farms,one a dairy farm and the other arable.Three other families are associated with farm work.The Manor House has become a goat farm which specialises in milk and cheese;and the occupants also operate a small caravan site overlooking the Eyebrook Reservoir.There is also a home-based company which runs a fleet of bulk grain carriers.Other residents follow professions which necessitate travel- ling to work.There is no new property but all existing houses have been renovated.There are no shops or bus service in Stoke Dry.The villagers are very community-minded,organising events if a need arises.One third of the people attend church services.
